sections.heading: Purpose of this screen
body: The Readings screen allows you to view and manage IoT devices linked to your plants.
Each device can send environmental measurements such as air temperature, air humidity, light level, and soil moisture to Flovers.
This feature is designed for users who build or use their own devices (for example based on Arduino or ESP boards) and want to monitor plant conditions over time.

sections.heading: Device tiles and latest readings
body: The screen displays a list of tiles, where each tile represents one linked device.
Each tile shows the plant name, location, and the latest readings received from the device.
If no data has been received yet, placeholders are shown instead of values.

sections.heading: Tile interactions
body: Tapping the tile body navigates directly to the Readings History screen for that device.
Tapping a specific reading icon (for example humidity or temperature) opens the Readings History screen with that parameter preselected.
This allows quick access to detailed charts for a specific measurement.

sections.heading: Device actions (3-dot menu)
body: Each device tile includes a 3-dot menu with additional actions.
Available options are: Readings history, Plant details, Edit device, and Delete device.
Deleting a device permanently removes it and its association with the plant.

sections.heading: Readings History
body: The Readings History screen displays detailed charts for collected sensor data.
Data can be viewed with daily, weekly, and monthly aggregation.
Charts are available for air temperature, air humidity, light level, and soil moisture (depending on what the device provides).

sections.heading: FAB actions
body: The Floating Action Button (FAB) provides actions related to device management and configuration.
Available actions include: Link device, Device setup, Sort, and Filter.
Sorting can be applied by plant name, location, or last read time.
Filtering can be applied by plant name, location, and device status (enabled or disabled).

sections.heading: Linking a device
body: Link device is used to set up a new reading device and associate it with a plant.
During setup, you select which readings should be displayed on the tile and optionally configure alerts (for example for low soil moisture).
Each device is assigned a unique Device ID and a secret Device Key used for authorization.

sections.heading: Device authentication and data flow
body: Devices authenticate using a Device ID and secret Device Key when sending readings to the backend.
No user authentication is required for inserting readings — authorization is handled entirely by the device credentials.
This design allows simple and lightweight IoT integrations.

sections.heading: Device setup and documentation
body: The Device setup option provides technical guidance for configuring your hardware.
It includes API endpoints (POST for sending readings, GET for retrieving data), example payloads, and configuration details.
Users can download full documentation, including sample code, wiring diagrams, suggested sensors, and setup instructions for supported boards.

sections.heading: Important notes
body: Device stability, calibration, and physical installation are the responsibility of the user.
Sensor readings are informative and should be interpreted together with real-world observation.
Flovers does not guarantee accuracy of third-party or self-built devices.
